title: Feature request: Custom Resolution
author: ciottied
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
Guys, fantastic product, but there is a feature missing that stops me to throw away RDCMan.
We have very strange desktop configurations (multiple vertical screen) and we use them to display remote desktops.
therefore, for us will be paramount the possibility to set custom resolutions.

I tried also editing the mRemoteNG *.xml config file and it doesn't work (res error)
But if I edit MS mstsc.exe  *.rdp file it does work, s...

iterations.description: Users with non-standard monitor setups (vertical, multi-monitor spans) need arbitrary RDP resolutions beyond the hardcoded enum list; mstsc.rdp already supports custom values so it's technically feasible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Users with non-standard monitor setups (vertical, multi-monitor spans) need arbitrary RDP resolutions beyond the hardcoded enum list; mstsc.rdp already supports custom values so it's technically feasible.
Approach: Add a 'Custom' entry to the RDPResolutions enum; when selected, expose ResolutionWidth/ResolutionHeight integer properties on ConnectionInfo that feed directly into the RDP ActiveX DesktopWidth/DesktopHeight. Update serializers to persist the custom values.
